snippet: The union’s president blames micromanagement from the top, with conflicting orders and too many school staff members being overwhelmed with paperwork and meetings.
abstract: Ernest A Logan, president of Council of Schools Supervisors and Administrators union in New York City, says Mayor Bill de Blasio's administration has not lived up to promise it had when de Blasio was elected; Logan warns that de Blasio's approach is destined to fail if it persists; union, while not as influential as teachers' union, is necessary ally in any effort to change city's schools.
lead_paragraph: The union’s president blames micromanagement from the top, with conflicting orders and too many school staff members being overwhelmed with paperwork and meetings.

headline.main: Principals’ Union Says Mayor de Blasio Has Lost Focus on Students
headline.print_headline: Principals Say Mayor Lost Focus on Students
